question: What is the purpose of software testing?
options: To ensure the software works on all operating systems
To find bugs and errors in the software
To improve the performance of the software
To beautify the user interface of the software
correct_answer: To find bugs and errors in the software

question: What is regression testing?
options: Testing the software after making changes to ensure that existing functionalities still work
Testing the software for the first time
Testing the software with a large number of users
Testing the software without documentation
correct_answer: Testing the software after making changes to ensure that existing functionalities still work

question: What is unit testing?
options: Testing individual units or components of the software in isolation
Testing the software with real-world scenarios
Testing the software for performance
Testing the software without any documentation
correct_answer: Testing individual units or components of the software in isolation

question: What is the purpose of black-box testing?
options: To test the internal structure, design, and implementation of the software
To test the functionality of the software without knowing its internal structure
To test the software in a controlled environment
To test the software using automated scripts
correct_answer: To test the functionality of the software without knowing its internal structure

question: What is load testing?
options: Testing the software with multiple users to assess its performance under high load
Testing the software with different operating systems
Testing the software for security vulnerabilities
Testing the software without any documentation
correct_answer: Testing the software with multiple users to assess its performance under high load

question: What is a test case?
options: A document that outlines the entire testing process
A set of conditions or variables under which a tester will determine whether an application, software system, or one of its features is working as it was originally established
A tool used for automating testing processes
A type of software used exclusively for testing
correct_answer: A set of conditions or variables under which a tester will determine whether an application, software system, or one of its features is working as it was originally established

question: What is the purpose of exploratory testing?
options: To test software functionalities based on test cases developed in advance
To test the software without any planning or documentation
To test the software using predefined scenarios
To test the software with multiple users
correct_answer: To test the software without any planning or documentation

question: What is a test plan?
options: A document that outlines the testing strategy for a software project
A document that describes the functionality of the software
A document that lists all the bugs found during testing
A document that specifies the hardware requirements for the software
correct_answer: A document that outlines the testing strategy for a software project

question: What is the difference between verification and validation in software testing?
options: Verification ensures that the software is built right, while validation ensures that the right software is built
Verification ensures that the software meets the specified requirements, while validation ensures that the software works as expected in its intended environment
Verification ensures that the software works on all operating systems, while validation ensures that the software works on different devices
Verification ensures that the software is secure, while validation ensures that the software is user-friendly
correct_answer: Verification ensures that the software meets the specified requirements, while validation ensures that the software works as expected in its intended environment

question: What is the purpose of stress testing?
options: To test the software with multiple users to assess its performance under high load
To test the software with different operating systems
To test the software for security vulnerabilities
To test the software without any documentation
correct_answer: To test the software beyond its normal operational capacity to assess its stability and robustness under extreme conditions
